Unknown.translation: Just as during dark nights, snake takes out its jewel, plays around with it and then hides it and does not show to anyone.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijgyˆ s`p hnyrI rwq ivc AwpxI mxI k`Fky r`Kdw hY qy Kyldw hY? pr Kyf Kyf ky Cupw lYˆdw hY qy iPr iksy nUM nhIˆ idKwauˆdw[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy br nwr kr ishjw sMjog Bog; hoq prBwq qn Cwdn CupwvhI [

Unknown.translation: Just as a virtuous wife enjoys the pleasure of the company of her husband at night and as the day breaks, re-drapes herself.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ sRySt iesqRI rwq smyˆ ishjw rc ky pI nwl sMjog kr ky Bog dw rs mwxdI hY pr svyr huMidAwˆ hI Awpxy srIr nUM k`piVAwˆ nwl Fk lYˆdI hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Al kml sMpt Acvq mD; Bor Bey jwq auf nwqo n jnwvhI [

Unknown.translation: Just as a bumble bee closed in the box-like lotus flower keep sucking the sweet elixir and flies away in the morning as soon as the flower blooms again without acknowledging any relationship with it.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ BOrw rwqIˆ kvl dy f`by ivc bYTw mDU rs Sihd Kwˆdw rihMdw hY, pr svyr hox qy auf jwˆdw hY qy Pul nwl koeI sMbMD nIˆ jxwauˆdw[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK auT bYTq AMimRq jog; sB suDw rs cwK suK iqRpqwvhI [568[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, an obedient disciple of the True Guru absorbs himself in the meditation of the Lord's name and feels satiated and blissful relishing the elixir like Naam. (But he does not mention his blissful state of the ambrosial hour to anyone).  (568)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ gurisK AMimRq vyly auT bYTdy hn qwˆ swry nwm rUpI AMimRq rs nUM c`Kdy qy suK ivc iqRpqdy hn, pr ies imlwp nUM idny iksy nUM jxwauˆdy nhIˆ ]568]
